official-title.#text:
To provide to the Secretary of the Interior a mechanism to cancel contracts for the sale of
			 materials CA–20139 and CA–22901, and for other purposes.

header.#text: Right of Local Land Use Authority To Purchase Certain Land

shall provide to the applicable local
			 land use authority an exclusive preemptive right, as determined under
			 State law, to purchase any right, title, or interest of the United States
			 in and to any portion of the parcels of land identified as

text.#text: Before a sale of land under subsection (a), the

quote.#tail: on the Map that is located within the jurisdiction of the local land use authority.

text.#text:
A preemptive right under paragraph (1) shall be in effect for a period of 30 days before the land
			 is sold under subsection (a).

During the period described in paragraph (2), the local land use authority may purchase some or all
			 of the right, title, and interest of the United States, as provided in
			 subsection (a), in and to the land to be offered for sale at fair market
			 value, as determined by an appraisal conducted by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall convey the land to the local land use authority immediately on
			 payment by the local land use authority of the entire purchase price of
			 the applicable parcel of land.

text.#text: If the local land use authority exercises the preemptive right under paragraph (1), the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may require shall terminate the preemptive
			 right of the local land use authority with respect to the right, title,
			 and interest offered for sale.

text.#text:
Failure by the local land use authority to purchase and pay for the right, title, and interest of
			 the United States in and to the land described in paragraph (1) within the
			 time period described in paragraph (2) and to comply with any other terms
			 and conditions as the
Subject to valid existing rights, the land described in subsection (a) is withdrawn from—
entry, appropriation, or disposal under the public land laws;
location, entry, and patent under the mining laws; and
operation of the mineral leasing, mineral materials, and geothermal leasing laws.

In any sale or other disposal of land under this section, there shall be reserved by the United
			 States the right of the United States to prospect for, mine, and remove
			 minerals from the conveyed land.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall consult with the City of
			 Victorville, the County of San Bernardino, and surface owners in the
			 jurisdiction in which the land is located regarding the potential impact
			 of the disposal and other appropriate aspects of the disposal.

text.#text: Subject to paragraph (3), the

text.#text: On completion of the first 2 payments to the contract holder under paragraph (1), the

text.#text: The

Upon acceptance and receipt of compensation under subsection (b), the contract holder shall waive
			 all claims against the United States arising out of, or relating to, the
			 cancellation of the contracts.
